iana.encoding_considerations:
A Logout Token is a JWT; JWT values are encoded as a series of 
   base64url-encoded values (some of which may be the empty string) 
   separated by period ('.') characters.

Security considerations: See 
   https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-backchannel-1_0.html#CrossJWT

Interoperability considerations: N/A
iana.additional_information:
1. Deprecated alias names for this type: N/A
   2. Magic number(s): N/A
   3. File extension(s): N/A
   4. Macintosh file type code: N/A
   5. Object Identifiers: N/A

General Comments: N/A
iana.template_text:
(registered 2022-10-07, last updated 2022-10-07)

Media type name: application

Media subtype name: logout+jwt

Required parameters: N/A

Optional parameters: N/A

Encoding considerations: binary

   A Logout Token is a JWT; JWT values are encoded as a series of 
   base64url-encoded values (some of which may be the empty string) 
   separated by period ('.') characters.

Security considerations: See 
   https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-backchannel-1_0.html#CrossJWT

Interoperability considerations: N/A

Published specification: 

   https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-backchannel-1_0.html

Applications which use this media: Applications that use Logout 
   Tokens to achieve back-channel logout

Fragment identifier considerations: N/A

Restrictions on usage: None

Additional information:

   1. Deprecated alias names for this type: N/A
   2. Magic number(s): N/A
   3. File extension(s): N/A
   4. Macintosh file type code: N/A
   5. Object Identifiers: N/A

General Comments: N/A

Person to contact for further information:

   1. Name: OpenID Foundation Artifact Binding Working Group
   2. Email: openid-specs-ab&lists.openid.net

Intended usage: COMMON

Author/Change controller: OpenID Foundation Artifact Binding Working 
   Group - openid-specs-ab&lists.openid.net
